Key Match Events: Stephen Curry scored the final 12 points for the Warriors to will them to a 120-117 victory over Klay Thompson and the Dallas Mavericks at Chase Center on Tuesday.
Curry's 28-foot step-back 3-pointer with 27.5 seconds left gave the Warriors a four-point lead and his game-sealing free throws capped a season-high 37-point outing.
Thompson tied a season-high with 22 points and six 3-pointers.
Pre-Game Insights: Understanding the stakes of the NBA Cup and his first opportunity to compete against his Splash Brother in an NBA game, Curry carried a fiery passion in his play on both ends of the court.
The Warriors improved to 3-1 at home on the season.
The Warriors improved to 7-1 in games against the NBA’s Western Conference.
Post-Match Reflections: NOW PLAYING: Postgame Warriors Talk: Stephen Curry - 11/12/24
NOW PLAYING: Postgame Warriors Talk: Draymond Green - 11/12/24
Miscellaneous Highlights: Klay Thompson returned to Chase Center for the first time since leaving the Warriors for the Mavericks.
The Warriors have won two of their last three meetings vs. the Mavericks, with all three contests decided by four points-or-less.
Golden State improved to 7-0 on the season when scoring 120-plus points.
The Warriors improved to 6-0 when outrebounding their opponent (50-40 tonight).
The Warriors are now 9-0 when leading after three quarters (96-89 tonight).
Others: Golden State's bench scored 42 points tonight, the 10th time they have scored at least 40 points in the last 11 games.
The Warriors trailed by as many as 11 points and went on to win, marking the team’s third double-figure comeback victory on the season (10/29 vs. NOP and 11/6 at BOS).
Stephen Curry tallied a season-high 37 points, his second consecutive game posting a season-high mark (36, 11/10 at OKC).

Kevon Looney grabbed nine offensive rebounds in 15 minutes off the bench, becoming the third player to record at least nine offensive rebounds in 15 minutes-or-less in league history (since offensive and defensive rebounds were first tracked in 1973-74 -- Elias Sports Bureau).
Draymond Green went 2-of-4 from three, and the Warriors improved to 174-37 all-time in games he makes two-or-more 3-point baskets (regular season and playoffs).
Trayce Jackson-Davis grabbed a season-high-tying nine rebounds (third time).
De’Anthony Melton dished out a season-high-tying four assists (done three times).
Kyle Anderson missed tonight’s game due to neck spasms.
